title: 7 Major 2025 Denim Trends for Under $150
description: The styles and silhouettes to have on your radar.
excerpt: From denim-on-denim looks to long jorts, we're sharing the seven major 2025 denim trends you can shop for under $150.
text: Denim is one of the hardest working fabrics in our wardrobes, and while it remains a steadfast staple, the variations of styles and silhouettes constantly change from year to year. Today, we're excited to dive into what denim trends 2025 has in store.Many of the dominating styles we spotted on the spring/summer 2025 runways are unequivocally easy to wear. While there was a smattering of looks embellished with statement crystals, patchwork, and floral appliqués, it was evident that relaxed, minimalist silhouettes ruled the runways.Wide-leg jeans continue their dominance in 2025, with brands such as Stella McCartney to Bottega Veneta backing long and loose puddle silhouettes that graze the floor. We saw some fresh styles such as loose and long jorts taking center stage along with unrestricted and relaxed denim skirt silhouettes that boast a sense of movement. This year is also proving to be the time to lean into the Canadian tuxedo with matching denim-on-denim looks.If you're looking to add a very 2025 denim silhouette to your wardrobe, then keep scrolling below as we highlight the major styles worth buying this year. And the best part? You don't have to spend your entire paycheck to try the trends. We've kept all our shopping picks to under $150.Double Denim(Image credit: Launchmetrics Spotlight/Ralph Lauren; Launchmetrics Spotlight/Kallmeyer; Launchmetrics Spotlight; Comey)It's impossible not to take note of the copious denim-on-denim outfits that ruled on the spring 2025 runways. From the loose and easy denim blouses and wide-leg jeans at Rachel Comey to the matching midi skirts and denim jackets at ACNE Studios, 2025 is officially the year to lean into a double-denim look. Buy a matching denim set to keep your look streamlined.Shop the trend: Denim Forum The 80s Comfy Denim Shirt aritzia The Farrah High-Rise Wide Jeans Collusion Collusion X002 Baggy Jeans in Raw Denim Collusion Tank Top in Raw Denim - Part of a Set Long and Loose Jorts(Image credit: Getty Images; Launchmetrics Spotlight/Opérasport; Launchmetrics Spotlight/Comey)Denim Bermuda shorts had a rise in popularity last summer and this year, we're about to see the style dominate, thanks to designers such as Filippa K, Opéra Sport, and Zimmermann. Opt for a loose and relaxed silhouette that hits just below the knee for a very 2025 take on the trend.Shop: urban outfitters Baggy Denim Jort Aritzia Snapshot Below-Knee Denim Short Abercrombie & Fitch Mid Rise Culotte Jean Straight-Leg Silhouettes(Image credit: Launchmetrics Spotlight/Valentino; Launchmetrics Spotlight/Coach; Getty Images)We are all happy to hear that straight-leg jeans are here to stay—thanks to brands such as Coach and Bally backing the minimalist trend—and they remain as versatile as ever to style with flats and heels alike. If you're in need of a straight-leg jeans update, try one of these below.Shop: madewell Curvy '90s Straight Jean Shopbop Daze Sundaze Jeans Unrestricted Denim Skirts(Image credit: Launchmetrics Spotlight/Versace; Getty Images; Launchmetrics Spotlight/Michael Kors)We spotted denim skirts of all lengths and washes on the S/S 2025 runways—but there was one feature that they had in common. They all boasted an unrestricted sense of movement with sinuous silhouettes. Skip the skintight styles of the past and opt for a skirt with a relaxed fit that you can move in.Shop: MANGO Denim Skirt With Metallic Detail ZARA Denim Midi Skirt ZW Collection GRLFRND Ivy Pleated Mini Skirt Seamed Jeans(Image credit: Launchmetrics Spotlight/Prabal Gurung; Launchmetrics Spotlight/Bally; Launchmetrics Spotlight/Ulla Johnson)If you want your jeans to look very 2025, then choose one of this year's coolest and most unexpected features on denim like defined front seams. It's a detail we spotted reoccurring across many shows and cities, from Ulla Johnson to Bally.Shop: Ann Taylor Crop Pintuck Jean ZARA ZW Collection High Waist Wide Leg Jeans abercrombie & Fitch Curve Love High Rise Loose Jean gap High Rise Stride Seamed Wide-Leg Jeans Wide-Leg Puddle Pants(Image credit: Launchmetrics Spotlight/Sandy Liang; Launchmetrics Spotlight/Halperin; Launchmetrics Spotlight/Stella McCartney)Baggy jeans are here to stay for 2025. Designers from Tommy Hilfiger to Stella McCartney showcased loose and relaxed wide-leg silhouettes in all washes and rises—many imitating the form of tailored trousers. Wear them extra long to create the runway-approved puddle effect.Shop: ZARA Trf High Rise Wide Leg Jeans MANGO Low Waist Wideleg Jeans H&M Bleecker High Rise Wide Leg Jeans abercrombie & fitch Curve Love High Rise Wide Leg Jean Pale Blue(Image credit: Launchmetrics Spotlight/Comey; @nlmarilyn; Launchmetrics Spotlight/Zimmermann)Okay, so there were also a whole host of deep, dark washes on the runways, but the pale-blue light washes really grabbed our attention because of how pervasive they were in the collections—especially in the form of wide-leg and bootcut silhouettes—oozing a free-spirited '70s vibe.Shop: aritzia The Farrah Hi-Rise Wide Jean Levi's Levi's 90's 501 Jeans abercrombie & fitch Low Rise Baggy Jean
html:
Denim is one of the hardest working fabrics in our wardrobes, and while it remains a steadfast staple, the variations of styles and silhouettes constantly change from year to year. Today, we're excited to dive into what denim trends 2025 has in store.

Many of the dominating styles we spotted on the spring/summer 2025 runways are unequivocally easy to wear. While there was a smattering of looks embellished with statement crystals, patchwork, and floral appliqués, it was evident that relaxed, minimalist silhouettes ruled the runways.

Wide-leg jeans continue their dominance in 2025, with brands such as Stella McCartney to Bottega Veneta backing long and loose puddle silhouettes that graze the floor. We saw some fresh styles such as loose and long jorts taking center stage along with unrestricted and relaxed denim skirt silhouettes that boast a sense of movement. This year is also proving to be the time to lean into the Canadian tuxedo with matching denim-on-denim looks.

If you're looking to add a very 2025 denim silhouette to your wardrobe, then keep scrolling below as we highlight the major styles worth buying this year. And the best part? You don't have to spend your entire paycheck to try the trends. We've kept all our shopping picks to under $150.

Double Denim

It's impossible not to take note of the copious denim-on-denim outfits that ruled on the spring 2025 runways. From the loose and easy denim blouses and wide-leg jeans at Rachel Comey to the matching midi skirts and denim jackets at ACNE Studios, 2025 is officially the year to lean into a double-denim look. Buy a matching denim set to keep your look streamlined.

Shop the trend:

Denim Forum

The 80s Comfy Denim Shirt

aritzia

The Farrah High-Rise Wide Jeans

Collusion

Collusion X002 Baggy Jeans in Raw Denim

Collusion

Tank Top in Raw Denim - Part of a Set

Long and Loose Jorts

Denim Bermuda shorts had a rise in popularity last summer and this year, we're about to see the style dominate, thanks to designers such as Filippa K, Opéra Sport, and Zimmermann. Opt for a loose and relaxed silhouette that hits just below the knee for a very 2025 take on the trend.

Shop:

urban outfitters

Baggy Denim Jort

Aritzia

Snapshot Below-Knee Denim Short

Abercrombie & Fitch

Mid Rise Culotte Jean

Straight-Leg Silhouettes

We are all happy to hear that straight-leg jeans are here to stay—thanks to brands such as Coach and Bally backing the minimalist trend—and they remain as versatile as ever to style with flats and heels alike. If you're in need of a straight-leg jeans update, try one of these below.

Shop:

madewell

Curvy '90s Straight Jean

Shopbop

Daze Sundaze Jeans

Unrestricted Denim Skirts

We spotted denim skirts of all lengths and washes on the S/S 2025 runways—but there was one feature that they had in common. They all boasted an unrestricted sense of movement with sinuous silhouettes. Skip the skintight styles of the past and opt for a skirt with a relaxed fit that you can move in.

Shop:

MANGO

Denim Skirt With Metallic Detail

ZARA

Denim Midi Skirt ZW Collection

GRLFRND

Ivy Pleated Mini Skirt

Seamed Jeans

If you want your jeans to look very 2025, then choose one of this year's coolest and most unexpected features on denim like defined front seams. It's a detail we spotted reoccurring across many shows and cities, from Ulla Johnson to Bally.

Shop:

Ann Taylor

Crop Pintuck Jean

ZARA

ZW Collection High Waist Wide Leg Jeans

abercrombie & Fitch

Curve Love High Rise Loose Jean

gap

High Rise Stride Seamed Wide-Leg Jeans

Wide-Leg Puddle Pants

Baggy jeans are here to stay for 2025. Designers from Tommy Hilfiger to Stella McCartney showcased loose and relaxed wide-leg silhouettes in all washes and rises—many imitating the form of tailored trousers. Wear them extra long to create the runway-approved puddle effect.

Shop:

ZARA

Trf High Rise Wide Leg Jeans

MANGO

Low Waist Wideleg Jeans

H&M

Bleecker High Rise Wide Leg Jeans

abercrombie & fitch

Curve Love High Rise Wide Leg Jean

Pale Blue

Okay, so there were also a whole host of deep, dark washes on the runways, but the pale-blue light washes really grabbed our attention because of how pervasive they were in the collections—especially in the form of wide-leg and bootcut silhouettes—oozing a free-spirited '70s vibe.

Shop:

aritzia

The Farrah Hi-Rise Wide Jean

Levi's

Levi's 90's 501 Jeans

abercrombie & fitch

Low Rise Baggy Jean
